title: Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Glass Top Desk with Lighting Fixture", February 26, 1937
medium: Graphite, black ink, and red color pencil on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: 8555/F.S./ANDERSON, OLSSON/P.S./D./2/26/37, 3/3/37, 1, MASTERCR.; inscribed in graphite, lower right: 1 DESK 50" LONG OVERALL 24" WIDE 29" HIGH/WHITE SYCAMORE & POLLARD OAK BURL/NATURAL FUR LAMB MAT FASTENED BY SNAPPERS OR ZIP/INTERIORS: SYCAMORE WHITE/FINISH ALL AROUND/TOP 1/2" TUFLEX  GLASS - POL. EDGES 49 1/2" LONG 24" WIDE/TURNABLE LAMP WITH ADJUSTABLE SHIELD  - POL CHROM BY OTHERS/POL.CHROM PULLS 7/8" DIA - 5" LONG/TWO DRAWERS AND/ONE BLIND DRAWER WITH REMOVABLE FRONT INSIDE BELL AND SWITCH/SWITCHBOX OPENING ON TOP TO HAVE EXTRA COVER VENEER GRAIN SAME AS REST OF TOP/WIRE OUTLET ON LEFT SIDE/PROVIDE STOPPERS FOR DRAWERS/USE DOMES OF SILENCE/NOTE!/DESK WILL BE SHIPPED WITH GLASS & LAMP UNASSEMBLED TO AVOID BREAKAGE/PROVIDE SCREWS & PLUGS FOR SAME AS SHOWN; dimensions, materials, instructions in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawings for glass top desk. Tuflex glass top with rounded right side and squared left side. Three stacked drawers at left in white sycamore; one blind drawer with removable front for bell and switch box. Pollard oak burl upright at left of drawers. Open shelf below top surface and above drawers at left. Knee hole towards right of desk with natural fur lamb mat below. Two half-circle shelves at right supporting light of polished chrome tube with horizontal light fixture; turnable lamp and adjustable shield in polished chrome. Shelves at right and base beneath fur mat in pollard oak burl.
